Key Match Events: The Kings shot an amazing 63% from the field in the first two quarters
The Suns made just 13 of 43 three-point attempts
Pre-Game Insights: The Suns were down the likes of Kevin Durant, Bradley Beal and Grayson Allen due to injury
Finding consistent scoring was always going to be a challenge for the Suns
Post-Match Reflections: The Suns kept the Kings honest until the final few minutes of action
The Kings eventually pulled away for a convincing 127-104 win
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Suns got off to a poor start thanks to numerous turnovers
The Kings outrebounded the Suns 28-19 in the first two quarters
The Suns emptied the bench with five minutes left and were down by 20
Others: Josh Okogie led all Suns in scoring with 25 points
DeMar DeRozan was forced out of action early and did not return
